TopicTitle: BSC - Ravenspear Mk. 1 - And the winner is...

Articles.Content:
Has anyone tested my plane yet?

If so, what can I improve on?

Tested your plane. No over pitch, but Hard to Yaw. Too much fuel, too less Air Intake...

For Air Intake, only use RAM air intake, that is the only usable air intake in High Altitute 6 to 1 TurboJect Ration is the best (Bring you up to 32km-Full throttle).

Landing no problem. Stable no ghost drifting. Basically is a good plane.

Improved on tail strike.. move your wheels backward (Prevent tail strike), and put your front wheels higher, so it shape like / (inclining up).

Engine facing direction should be inline...serially, having angle only decrease the performance. (Press shift + Q,E to finetune the angle).

Tested your plane. No over pitch, but Hard to Yaw. Too much fuel, too less Air Intake...

For Air Intake, only use RAM air intake, that is the only usable air intake in High Altitute 6 to 1 TurboJect Ration is the best (Bring you up to 32km-Full throttle).

Landing no problem. Stable no ghost drifting. Basically is a good plane.

Improved on tail strike.. move your wheels backward (Prevent tail strike), and put your front wheels higher, so it shape like / (inclining up).

Engine facing direction should be inline...serially, having angle only decrease the performance. (Press shift + Q,E to finetune the angle).

Ok, based on your feedback, I've:

-Changed the deluxe winglets to av-r8 winglets and moved them forward, giving the plane extra yaw, extra pitch, extra roll and reduced chance of tail strike. This also pushes the COL closer to the COM.

-moved the back gear back and the front gear back

I have not changed the radial intakes nor changed the angle of the engine nacelles because they are an integral part of the design and safety aspects.

Otherwise, I have:

-moved the position of the radial intakes to be better symmetrically

-added a strut to each engine to make sure they don't fall off unless the plane breaks apart; this pushes the part count two up to 38.

Edited October 1, 2013 by FlandersNed

Let me introduce Speed Fury, very fast, very easy for fly and landing, equiped with emergency escape system.

Brief tech info:

Mass: 8.3 t

Parts count: 37

Number of engines: 1 (one engine prevent from rotating in case of jet flameout)

Maximum speed: 1600-1800 m/s

Lift-off speed: ~90 m/s

Landing speed: 35-45 m/s

Effective range: almost circumnavigate Kerbin

Crew count: 1 or 0 (can be used in unmanned mode for dangerous tests or practice)

Key bindings:

1 - open antenna (for cool view)

2 - on/off ladder

Abort - off engine, decouple plane from cabine, open chute

Lift-off instruction:

1. Turn on SAS;

2. Full throtle

3. After 80 m\s turn up nose and fly;

4. Off gear

Landing:

Off engine, on gear, nose up for drop speed at 50-60 m/s and after it easily landing with nose up at about 10 degrees (vertical landing speed 4-5 m\s). You can land without any touches to keys.

Some pictures:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Craft file: here

I've tested all of the entries so far by flying them until they crash (a very bad way to evaluate planes) and here are some of the things I want to say:

- Zekes' plane is very maneuverable

- Gusturbo's plane flies kinda like my plane

- Daveofdefeat's plane is mounted on a launch clamp for some reason

- HueHue's plane has its center of lift too far back

- A few planes had rolling issues

- Some planes pitch very slowly (those didn't last very long in my tests)

O hay how did you like mine? PS I was going through my planes pics and realized I have an intake on the left side missing 0.0 oopps, will update download later.
